intro: Tetraria lucida, commonly known as the shining tetraria, is a small, herbaceous plant native to the temperate regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Tetraria lucida is often found in moist, shady habitats such as forest floors or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it a distinctive member of its family, with a unique appearance that aids in its identification.
